Sent from my iPad using Tapatalk
The servers not really unkind to newbies... it just tends to serve them up with a side of asparagus and a nice red sauce.

I second Max's recommendation.  WoG is an awesome server, just be forewarned that it has been challenge balanced in favor of the natural inhabitants and not the players.  
The DM team has done a spectacular job in making sure that most areas scale to your level.  

While party play is not required, the scaling is based on the fact that party play is encouraged.
LOL.. though that makes the payoff for solo play that much higher...

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: World of Greyhawk is a great place for anyone want a medium magic setting & a tough but rewarding experience and you can grab the module itself from the vault, to see if you like it, unlike Arelith for example. Other good servers do exist, such as Ravenloft, Thay, Three Towns & The North but I do not know of their status nowadays. Good luck in your search.

How's it going, old friend?

It's been a while! Since you stopped by to comment on this thread, I'm here to let you know that WoG has undergone a facelift! Many new areas, old quests have been revamped, areas added and / or changed! Wise has been busy! And there are many new players logging on. Maybe it's time for you to dust off some of your old builds and take them for a spin? All old characters are gone, which on the downside means you'll lose all the toons you had on Raine's computer. On the flipside, you can replay them all! I'm replaying all my favorite characters: Maximillian Kane, Aegis Silverwolfe, Melvin Manhoef, Natalya Salomon, Nathyrra, and a bunch of new toons, from BG (Aerie, Jan Jansen, Imoen, Cernd) and from my ECB tomes (Subtle Death, Draconic Arcanist, Underdark Expeditioner, Drow Fencer, Guard Captain (not posted, but basically a Fighter 12 / WM 25 / Rogue 3), Demolition Man). It'd be great to have you back!

Cheers!

posts.author: grom56
posts.content:
Max, it may be a bit of a vain hope, but we GreyHawkers are hoping that Raine get's all the old toons back one day!  
And yes, Wise has done great work overhauling WoG these past few months!  Folks who haven't been out there since last summer, would not know the place!!
It is a low to medium magic world...   Highest plus to be found is +5 ( with a very few rare +6's out there!)  But it is a blast....  Solo is tough, but rewarding as Max said...  However it shines during Party Play!   Get a group of 6 to 7 players, all working together and it's a whole different game!!

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Aye, and that seems to be true for most of the Neverwinter Nights servers nowadays Kal, as it takes a considerable amount of willpower to have a server running non-stop for more than a decade...That being said, there are still good PW's out there for people that want to play online and experience the game differently than the normal module-only play. And I know, that in the age that some of us are, "change" is hard and everything must be considered it carefully before even attempted, but playing in a good PW with other people is second to none. No amount of Aielund or any other top-of-the-line module can rival that. The whole thing is as close to a true Dungeons & Dragons experience you can have apart from rolling the dice physically in the company of a great DM. And don't be afraid that you are a noob and you will not do well, that's everyone at the beginning and it is part of the fun!

So, go out there and play while you still can ;)
